content.body:
Is the build for fetch broken on main? Locally I'm seeing:
```
jgraham@goldfinch:~/develop/fetch$ git fetch origin 
jgraham@goldfinch:~/develop/fetch$ git checkout main 
Switched to branch 'main'
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/main'.
jgraham@goldfinch:~/develop/fetch$ make
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100  374k    0   146  100  374k     18  49062  0:00:07  0:00:07 --:--:--    40

Error running preprocessor, returned code: 2.
FATAL ERROR: Spurious / in <a>.
 ✘  Did not generate, due to fatal errors
make: *** [Makefile:5: remote] Error 22

```
content.formatted_body:
Is the build for fetch broken on main? Locally I'm seeing:

jgraham@goldfinch:~/develop/fetch$ git fetch origin 
jgraham@goldfinch:~/develop/fetch$ git checkout main 
Switched to branch 'main'
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/main'.
jgraham@goldfinch:~/develop/fetch$ make
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100  374k    0   146  100  374k     18  49062  0:00:07  0:00:07 --:--:--    40

Error running preprocessor, returned code: 2.
FATAL ERROR: Spurious / in <a>.
 ✘  Did not generate, due to fatal errors
make: *** [Makefile:5: remote] Error 22

content.body: `make local` works fine, so maybe there's a difference between the remote version of bikeshed and the local one?
content.formatted_body: make local works fine, so maybe there's a difference between the remote version of bikeshed and the local one?

content.body: (also I really do prefer specs that don't depend on make for unclear reasons)

This might be the Bikeshed parser changes TabAtkins made. I'm not sure if he tested those on just the tests or also live copies of the current specifications. I haven't really done any specification development recently.
content.formatted_body: This might be the Bikeshed parser changes TabAtkins made. I'm not sure if he tested those on just the tests or also live copies of the current specifications. I haven't really done any specification development recently.
